newsitem.title: GERMANY: Daimler to buy heavy truck business from Ford.
newsitem.headline: Daimler to buy heavy truck business from Ford.

text.p: Daimler-Benz AG said Wednesday its U.S. truck subsidiary Freightliner has agreed to buy the heavy truck business of Ford Motor Co.
Financial details were not immediately available.
Daimler said that under the deal, Ford will turn over production, research and development of its "HN80" truck to Freightliner.
The deal also calls for Freightliner to take over production of Ford's L-Series trucks and Ford cargo trucks.
The Ford vehicles are sold in the United States, Canada and Australia, Daimler said in a statement.
Freightliner, based in Portland, Ore., and acquired in 1981 by Daimler, said the Ford deal would push its annual revenues to more than 1 billion marks ($595 million).

Daimler also said Ford would remain in the light and mid-sized truck business while Freightliner would add important products in the market for construction and other trucks that weigh eight to 15 metric tons.
Ford's stock slipped 12.5 cents to $33.125 on the New York Stock Exchange. Daimler's U.S. shares lost 62.5 cents to $72.625, also on the NYSE.
